text: Companies of all sizes are increasingly migrating their
workloads from on-premises to the cloud,
taking advantage of its wide-ranging benefits.
Cloud computing enhances scalability, allowing organizations
to easily adjust resources to meet changing demands.
It provides a cost-effective solution
by eliminating upfront investments in hardware
and infrastructure all while improving agility,
so businesses can innovate faster
and respond to changing market conditions.
On-premises infrastructure requires upfront
and ongoing CapEx investment - not to mention expertise -
for setup, configurations, maintenance,
and scaling. Cloud-based services allow organizations
to avoid these issues, offering a compelling
alternative to on-premises.
In fact, organizations who migrated
to AWS from on-premises saw, on average, up
to 66% cost savings and 43% faster time to market.
With AWS,  you get innovation
that directly impacts your business.
Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud or EC2 provides secure
and resizable compute capacity for virtually any workload.
Run anything, from simple web applications
to complex machine learning models in the cloud.
EC2 offers the broadest
and deepest selection of instances - allowing customers
to select the optimal balance of compute, memory, storage,
and network resources to tailor infrastructure
to their workload needs.
EC2 instances are also scalable -
it can be resized and customized to meet changing demands.
Advanced features like Auto Scaling
and Load Balancing enable businesses to optimize performance
and efficiently manage their cloud computing resources.
EC2 seamlessly integrates with other AWS services.
Instances are powered by an extensive portfolio
of specialized and general-purpose chips,
including AWS Graviton processor - first introduced in 2018.
At the foundation of modern EC2 instances is the AWS Nitro
System, a lightweight hypervisor
that offloads virtualization for functions
to dedicated hardware
and software - delivering practically all of the resources
of a server to your instances.
You can set up and manage your EC2 instances
with just a few clicks from the AWS Management console
or automate the process
through an API using your preferred programming language.
There are no upfront costs to migrating to EC2,
with a flexible pay-as-you-go model -
you can always scale resources up or down as needed.
Get started with EC2.
Simply create an AWS account
and launch EC2 instances within minutes. Migrate to secure,
scalable and resizable cloud computing
with Amazon EC2, from AWS.
